hdview: High-Density Polyethylene (HDPE) is a thermoplastic polymer made from petroleum. It is known for its high strength-to-density ratio.
ldview: Low-Density Polyethylene (LDPE) is a thermoplastic made from the monomer ethylene. It is used for various products including plastic bags, containers, dispensing bottles, and tubing.
petview: Polyethylene Terephthalate (PET) is a thermoplastic polymer resin of the polyester family. It is commonly used in fibers for clothing, containers for liquids and foods, and thermoforming for manufacturing.
ppview: Polypropylene (PP) is a thermoplastic polymer used in a wide variety of applications. It is produced via chain-growth polymerization from the monomer propylene.
psview: Polystyrene (PS) is a synthetic aromatic hydrocarbon polymer made from the monomer styrene. It can be solid or foamed and is used in a wide range of applications.
pvcview: Polyvinyl Chloride (PVC) is a synthetic plastic polymer widely used in building and construction for producing door and window profiles, pipes, etc.
